result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J. Burnett

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:46 PM Defendant Justin J. Burnett not in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Justin J. Burnett.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.
Arrest warrant authorized.  Defendant is to be remanded into custody in order to take care of this warrant.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.
Prints to MTPD.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-17-2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 1.  Bail is set at $2500 recognizance bond with the conditions that the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and the defendant is to have no contact with J.A.K. and E.R.K. and any premises they occupy.  Defendant is remanded into custody on another matter.  Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant served.
Copies to DA, defendant and Georgio Williams.
Copies to DA, defendant and Georgio Williams.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

2:05 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Burnett not in court.  Attorney Luke Harrison appears in Court for defendant.  State requests warrant and forfeiture of bail.  Court authorizes warrant and forfeiture of bail.  No return on warrant will be allowed.

2:11 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Burnett not in court. Attorney Nathan Heim appearing for the defendant.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.  Defendant has plea date in Br. 2 tomorrow at 3:30 p.m.  Attorney Heim asks that warrant be held until then to see if he appears.

2:24 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Burnett appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant.  More time requested for public defender to appoint counsel.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:53 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Burnett appeared by video.  Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel in this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

2:18 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J. Burnett appeared by video.  Public defender has not appointed counsel in this matter yet.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 07-06-22 at 1:30 p.m. following 22 CF 398.  Hopefully attorney will be appointed by this date.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

$150.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Georgio Williams, 812 School Street, Manitowoc, WI   54220.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 06-13-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 5 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $150.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with J.A.K. and E.R.K. and any premises they occupy.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
